title: Jerome Powell’s Comments Over the Past Year Show Mounting Inflation Concerns
sub_head: The Fed chief spent much of the first half of 2021 linking higher inflation readings to soon-to-be-resolved supply disruptions
body:
The past year hasn’t been kind to the Federal Reserve’s inflation outlook.
Chairman Jerome Powell’s views on price pressures have undergone an evolution over the past 12 months, as inflation surged and remained elevated, crashing into the Fed’s one-time expectation that the phenomenon would be a short-lived product of reopening the economy following pandemic shutdowns.
